title: General Grant National Memorial: Photo Gallery
body: Photo Gallery       Welcome to the Photo Gallery Page, a place to see beautiful pictures of the memorial, and to learn a little about the ideas that inspired it.   Be sure to check out our Facebook page to see the latest photos of special events!                   Architecture of the Memorial - Exterior   6 Photos  The memorial was designed in 1891 by the New York City architect John H. Duncan (1855 – 1929). His design was primarily inspired by the Mausoleum of Halicarnassus, one of the seven wonders of the ancient world, along with other influences.          Artwork of the Memorial - Interior   13 Photos  The interior of the General Grant National Memorial was decorated to honor his service and influence. The layout of the interior, as designed by John H. Duncan, was largely inspired by the tomb of Napoleon Bonaparte located within the Dôme des Invalides in Paris.          Nightime at the Tomb   8 Photos  See the tomb and its grounds in a "different" light.            Sons of Union Veterans Ceremony   5 Photos            U.S. Grant Birthday Celebration   14 Photos
